intro: Morrisiella morriaii, commonly known as the Morriaii rock orchid, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South Africa. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features a compact growth habit with a single, erect stem that bears a few lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellow, with a distinctive three-lobed lip. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
